medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 2 days prior to presentation; they were sudden in onset. The intensity and further details of progression are not specified.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Known to have Russell-Silver syndrome (RSS) and suffered a subarachnoid hemorrhage (SAH) at age 25 due to a left middle cerebral artery (MCA) aneurysm, which was clipped. Also received growth hormone therapy as a child.
medical_history.family_history: The patient's younger brother also has RSS but with no vascular abnormalities detected. Parents are consanguineous (second cousins). Her two older male siblings are genetically normal.
medical_history.social_history: Cigarette smoker with 8 pack-years. On medical advice, the patient has stopped smoking.
